intro: Eriogonum molestum var. davidsonii, commonly known as the Davidson's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its fibrous root system helps it survive in poor soil conditions.
